newsitem.title: USA: Md. unemployment rate drops to 4.6 pct for March.
newsitem.headline: Md. unemployment rate drops to 4.6 pct for March.

text.p: Maryland's unemployment rate dropped to 4.6 percent in March from five percent the month before, the state's Department of Labor, Licensing and Regulation said Friday.

Unemployment rates dropped in each of the state's 24 local jurisdictions as well, with the Baltimore metropolitan area falling to 5.1 percent from 5.4 percent and District of Columbia suburbs dropping to 3.2 percent from 3.5 percent.
The rates are not seasonally adjusted, the department said.
Montgomery County scored the lowest unemployment rate, at 2.2 percent.
Statewide, employment grew by more than 19,000 people to a record high for the month of 2.6 million.
